final_answer.precision_note: Reported to 3 significant figures (0.0200 mol dm-3) based on given data.

method: Use the dilution relationship c1V1 = c2V2. The initial concentration is c1 = 0.200 mol dm-3 and 25.0 cm3 is transferred, then diluted to 250.0 cm3. Volumes can be used in the same units, so c2 = c1×V1/V2 = 0.200×(25.0/250.0) = 0.0200 mol dm-3.
checks: Volume increased by factor 10, so concentration should decrease by factor 10 (0.200 -> 0.0200).
Units stay as mol dm-3 because only dilution changes concentration, not amount of solute.
